hi my name is Patrick qua at the moment
my role is CTO of n 26 where a
Challenger Bank here in Berlin Germany
so we have a German banking license we
have more than 1.5 million customers in
Europe going to the UK and moving to the
US so very exciting times I've done a
lot of research talking with tech leads
also training a lot of tech leads
understanding the journey that have been
on the challenges they face and trying
to always help them get better and
better there are many challenges that
our tech lead faces I think probably the
biggest hurdle is really when people are
moving from sort of an engineer role
into their first leadership role I talk
often about this challenge of moving
from maker to multiplayer mode so a lot
of people sort of often reward with what
they produce what they personally have
solved themselves and when they move
into a leader role often one of the sort
of challenges is overcoming that
internal drive of how you reward
yourself of not what you produce but
actually what you enable the whole team
to produce and this is one of the
biggest challenges for people because
they're not often prepared by their
organization by their sort of team that
they're rewarded for a different outcome
and it's one of the biggest challenges
for tech leads to face when they're in
this role for the first time
so I think to make the change from
moving from an engineer to attack lien
there's a few things that I think are
very helpful so I run a tech lead course
we run a tech lead development program
and step one is a awareness so it's like
anything new it's helping people
understand that this thing is very
different from this thing and then I
think when people start to recognize
actually this thing is a very different
role and requires very different skills
that sort of starts them on the journey
on this transition the second part is
really about then equipping people with
the skills to be successful in this role
so I often explain how a lot of the
skills as an engineer refactoring code
testing code don't really prepare you
for dealing with conflict for people
influencing and getting buy-in from
people of helping people overcome sort
of their internal sort of challenges so
that they can focus on being perfect
productive so I think awareness is step
one equipping people with skills is step
two and then step three is really about
this ability to sort of practice and not
wanting to sort of fail too hard so I
think a lot of people are afraid of
failure
when they first step into this
leadership role because they're I guess
aware of the impact it may have on other
people in the team so you know they
always try to shoulder everything
themselves they try to take their
responsibility in burden and it kind of
accumulates and accumulates but it's
actually also really key for people to
have that support structure to get
feedback that they are maybe maybe
failing or in the wrong way or they can
adjust some behavior because it's the
natural process of learning and you have
to sort of fail to learn what not to do
you have to go through that experience
and organizations need to give people
that sort of safety

so I think one of the reasons I'm really
passionate about this theme is actually
it's a personal story as well so I think
when I first went into my first hit lead
role
I remember actually being in an airport
so I was consulting at the time I was on
a project I was an airport coming back
from I think it was a long weekend I got
a call saying oh actually hey Pat you're
not going to go back to this team we
want you to start leading this team over
here and you know I was going through
these challenges I was like well like I
need to be doing something but then I'm
torn because I have all these other
people and they need guidance and nobody
helped me understand what that was about
and you know I think one of the great
things about our industry is that we're
so generous with our knowledge we have
Wikipedia we have open source we have
Stack Overflow and it's really about
raising you know the industry game and I
think this is one of the reasons is I
want to really help people also go
through that process and you know as
technology grows there's more people
going through this all the time and it
can feel really lonely and so what I
wanted to do was really help connect
people who were going through this
process and equip them with that because
I think I industry will be much better
for it we focus very much on technical
skills we don't really focus on sort of
the often harder skills which are called
soft skills around leading dealing with
people communicating well and there are
central skills that people need as to be
successful as leaders
